attributes.action: Education funding should be ring fenced pupils funded equally.
attributes.background: Changes announced today (14 December) in the way schools will be funded in the future is just robbing Peter to pay Paul. Children are our future and they should be educated equally whenever they live.
attributes.additional_details: Schools are oversubscribed in some areas and others undersubscribed however equal funding would  hopefully address this problem and enable heads to allocate funding according to the needs of their pupils.

attributes.action: Evacuate Aleppo with joint UN task force, giving refuge in Britain to citizens.
attributes.background: The city of Aleppo has been conquered by the dictator Assad. His forces are massacring its people - men, women and children. It is preventable. Ask the government to petition a UN/EU task force to immediately go into the city as peacekeepers, not to directly fight Assad, but to evacuate citizens.
attributes.additional_details: All over twitter, Aleppo refugees are posting how the government is murdering them en masse. Innocent men, women and children. The UN must condemn the massacre as against international law, and the UN, failing them the EU, failing that Britain alone, mut notify Assad of its intent, and send a task force to the city. Not to fight Assad's forces directly, but to advise his troops to not engage, & to protect any citizen fleeing the city against his troops, withdrawing when the people are removed.

attributes.action: A  Vote of No Confidence in the Transport Secretary re Southern Railways dispute
attributes.background: The Transport Secretary has made it clear  he has no interest in the Southern/RMT/ASLEF rail dispute. People have lost their jobs, been refused job interviews & in some cases missed hospital appointments. His lack of action is grossly negligent and he should no longer be a government minister.

attributes.action: Begin phasing out the sale of new fossil-fuel powered cars by 2018
attributes.background: Although by no means the only cause of air pollution, there is an opportunity to make inroads into NOx emissions by the gradual phasing-out of fossil-fuel powered cars, commencing with banning company car fleets from purchasing anything other than fully electric vehicles by 2018.
attributes.additional_details: Then, sales of private non-electric-powered cars must be prohibited by 2025.  Obviously, this must be supported by additional scrappage schemes to help those who must buy cars to meet the additional costs of electric vehicles AND (more importantly), massively increased investment in public transport but by starting with fleets, this will mean the first phase of eliminating fossil fuel powered cars will by carried out by those best placed to absorb the costs - i.e. large businesses

attributes.action: Resurface the A11 between Attleborough Wymondham
attributes.background: The government are talking about spending 3 plus billion pounds on improving congested roads, not a bad thing. But we have a stretch of road between that the surface is diabolic it is dangerous for all road uses, it desperately needs doing before some gets killed.
attributes.additional_details: Most of the section is made from concrete, when cracks, pot holes etc. Appear they are being patch with tarmac, as soon as the weather is bad these repair break down and the holes reappear.

attributes.action: Reinstate legal aid for students and people on a low income
attributes.background: Many people need the help of solicitors and courts all around the UK for various reasons but can't afford the costs by themselves. The 1st of April 2013 saw legal aid was discontinued. This petition will see that people are able to receive help in many cases that legal aid covered.
attributes.additional_details:
When legal aid was discontinued this meant some types of case were no longer eligible for public funds - including divorce, child contact, welfare benefits, employment, clinical negligence, and housing law except in very limited circumstances. (BBC news) 
This petition should be looked into by Houses of Parliament and even if only a few were reinstated for legal aid such as child contact being the main issue as every parent and child should be together and some parents can't afford legal costs.

attributes.action: Make it law for companies to let applicants know if they have got a job or not.
attributes.background: When we apply for a job many of us find that we don't hear a thing back from the company concerned.  This has to stop, not only is it downright rude of a company/employer small or large to not tell people if they did not get a job.  I think it also has a negative affect on confidence.

attributes.action: Add the option for 'None of the Above' on Local / General Election Ballot Papers
attributes.background: Voting is being effected by the lack of a direct, quantifiable outlet for frustrated people to express themselves.It causes negative voting and confused issues. People should have a way to say candidates/campaigns tactics are not good enough;if say 25% reached a rerun with new candidates triggered.
attributes.additional_details: Voting should be a positive experience. i.e FOR someone or something. Too often, the choice is often about the 'least worst option'. The ballot paper needs to give a credible alternative.The electorate needs a way to encourage postive campaigning and ultimately reject a set of bad candidates.I believe by giving everyone the option of quanitfiably registering their frustration with candidates/campaigns we can force politicians away from devisive language and personal attacks & increase turn out.

attributes.action: Change the way child maintenance payments are assessed and calculated.
attributes.background:
Currently the child maintenance system is calculated on a percentage based on what the paying parent earns.
https://www.gov.uk/how-child-maintenance-is-worked-out/how-the-child-maintenance-service-works-out-child-maintenance
attributes.additional_details: parents should contribute to what it costs to raise a child and not a percentage of their wage. Many find ways to avoid paying child maintenace due to the current calculation.Many receiving abuse the system and spend the income on other stuff other than the child. There should be a national avg amount calculated of what it costs to bring up a child and this amount should be split equally between the parents minus any child benefits the mother received and should be based on the age of the child.

attributes.action: Adopt British summer Time from mid February to mid November.
attributes.background:
Almost nobody looks forward to the clocks going back, at the end of October, and despite this, we persist with this oppressive schedule.  
My proposal is to adopt BST from Mid Feb to mid Nov. shortening the dark winter evenings.  I believe this would be very good for national morale.
attributes.additional_details:
It is said that the mornings are too dark in Scotland.  On the current regime, it is broad daylight in Edinburgh at 8.00 am by the end of January.  As a Scot, I am sure that mid February would be a good moment to move to BST.  It is a long haul through to the end of March. 
 
Light at the end of the day is far more useful for healthy recreation and exercise, and environmentally, less energy would be used with lighter evenings, because more people are up and about in the afternoon.

attributes.action: make abortion illegal in the uk unless raped or health risks to mum or baby
attributes.background: make abortion illegal in the united kingdom unless pregnant by rape or there is health risks to the mum and/or baby

attributes.action: Let voters (Eng, Wal, NI) decide if they want Scotland to remain in Britain.
attributes.background: The Scottish had their say on whether they wanted to remain in Britain or not, but the rest of Britain didn't. No one has taken into consideration what the rest of Britain would like to see and it would only be fair for everyone to have an equal say in the out come from both sides. Let us vote!

attributes.action: Create a national database to check who has a current DBS certificate.
attributes.background: I believe there is a massive loophole, which potential allows paedophiles and other inappropriate adults access to the most vulnerable in our society. As parents/guardians we no right to check DBS certificates are in place. Neither the Charity Commission or the DBS check they have been done.
attributes.additional_details: I had reason to ask for confirmation that DBS certificates were in place at a charity my sister attends (she is a vulnerable adult). They refused, their response to my request was to threaten to report me to the Police for harassment. The charity is now being investigated by SAFA - Hertfordshire Police unit responsible for 'Safeguarding Adults from Abuse'due to serious Safeguarding issues.

attributes.action: Update the law, to allow subjects of unhappiness or same-sex adultery a divorce.
attributes.background: Laws surrounding divorce in the UK are woefully outdated. UK courts neither recognise same-sex adultery, nor blatant unhappiness as suitable grounds for divorce. As a supposedly progressive country, we need to give unhappy people a choice, and take our divorce laws into the twenty-first century.
attributes.additional_details: In March 2017, Tini Owens, 66, lost her case at the court of appeal. She described herself as 'desperately unhappy' in her marriage of 39 years. She says her husband has been dismissive, insensitive, distrusting and generally unloving towards her for years. Even if Tini Owens is lying, and wants to leave her marriage - why should any court be in a position to stop her?! This is embarrassingly backward legislation, and needs reforming urgently.

attributes.action: Repeal the ban on laptops and tablets on flights from six Middle East countries
attributes.background:
The UK has banned laptops, tablets and similar devices "larger than a normal smartphone" on all direct passenger flights from Turkey, Lebanon, Jordan, Egypt, Tunisia and Saudi Arabia.

Whilst they can be placed in the hold, for many this is an unacceptable and unfounded risk and inconvenience.
attributes.additional_details:
Students, professionals and others for whom their laptops represent an important part of their academic and/or working lives, will be asked to entrust their devices to the hold of the aircraft. 

Issues of theft or damage aside, to be parted from such a valuable device (both literally and figuratively) on such arbitrary grounds as those presented, is simply unacceptable.

I sadly, have come to expect such nonsense from Trump - but believe that we in the UK can do much better than this.

attributes.action: MPs taking other jobs of more than 20 hours a week must stand for re-election.
attributes.background: George Osborne is only the latest, but nevertheless the most egregious example of an MP expressing contempt for both parliament and his constituents by hoovering up money wherever it can be found.

attributes.action: Make Commonwealth Day a public holiday in the UK.
attributes.background: Commonwealth Day is the second Monday in March. When the UK leaves the EU it will need to be global facing to make Brexit a success. Celebrating Commonwealth Day with a public holiday will help remind the UK public of its friends around the world who share history and cultural values with the UK.

attributes.action: Make teaching a nuanced account of the British Empire statutory in KS3 History
attributes.background: In their next revision of the national curriculum, the UK government should update Key Stage 3 history so that teaching about the British Empire is statutory. A nuanced account about the oppressive nature of the empire is needed to education those who are unaware of Britain's problematic empire

attributes.action: Include companies' wrongdoings to employees in the list of protected disclosures
attributes.background: Allow all information about retail companies' wrongdoings to their employees to be published and protected by law. We want to know the names of companies that such allegations are about and see all information in relation to the allegations even if it is confidential or intellectual property.
attributes.additional_details:
We demand that the government change the law on raising awareness about companies' wrongdoings called 'whistleblowing' (disclosure in the public interest).

Retail companies that are doing wrong to their employees cannot be trusted. The public are customers of retail companies. Therefore, if such companies are doing wrong to an employee then the disclosure of the wrongdoing should always be protected by law as it is in the public interest to know about the wrongdoing.

attributes.action: Standardise dress sizes
attributes.background: It's about time that we standardise dress sizes here in the UK. The fact that a woman could be a size 8 and a size 16 in the same shop is ridiculous.  This is 2017 and it's about time there were guidelines for suppliers to follow.
attributes.additional_details: This affects everyone from babies, woman of all ages, shapes and sizes to our young impressionable girls who already have to struggle with what the media tells them they have to look like.

attributes.action: People to be fined if, deemed by paramedics that the call is not an emergency.
attributes.background: People are to be fined £150, if paramedics deem the call to be a non-emergency. To help prevent time-wasting calls across Britain. This will allow for the NHS to not be under as much pressure and abuse that they are now.
attributes.additional_details: Local news has shown, nurses, paramedics and other health care staff are abused on a regular basis, in hospitals, doctors surgeries and on the road attending 999 calls. These types of people and calls should be put to a stop, to help our Emergency services.

attributes.action: Make all car insurers allow drivers to volunteer for the NHS, by use of the car.
attributes.background: I am shocked to learn that I am not allowed to volunteer to help the NHS by doing a volunteering job, by helping patients get to their appointments at hospital and back home. This is what they would call business use of the vehicle, and this is what I would call a breach of human rights.
attributes.additional_details: I received an email from my insurer which said: “Thank you for choosing Debenhams Car Insurance. Please note that you are not covered for carrying passengers as this is considered as business use.”

attributes.action: Abolish Vehicle Excise Duty (VED) and put extra tax on fuel
attributes.background:
The air in British cities is polluted by exhaust fumes and is killing thousands of people.

 Abolish VED and replace it with extra fuel tax of 3 p per litre on petrol and 10 p per litre on diesel so that the tax paid is in line with mileage and using the most polluting vehicles is discouraged.
attributes.additional_details:
See this link
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/business-34257424
and many more press reports

attributes.action: Let the speaker speak! A motion of the House in support of the Speaker.
attributes.background: On the 06th February the Speaker of the House of Commons spoke up to voice the views of many that President Trump not be allowed to address the House. Now he faces a no confidence motion.This petition seeks support for the debate of a counter motion of support for his position.Don't gag the Speaker!
attributes.additional_details: James Duddridge MP has sought to attack the Speaker. Over 1 million people signed a petition objecting to Trump's State visit and furthermore there is disquiet across the House regarding it. The Speaker must maintain order and preserve the dignity of the House. He was accordingly obliged to intervene when the Prime Minister elected to offer a State visit to such a divisive figure who sows discord and disorder.Let the Speaker Speak.

attributes.action: Make vaccinations for Meningitis B available to all babies and children!
attributes.background: After seeing another child lost to meningitis B in the news we need to address that there is a vaccination available for £155 but the government won't routinely provide it to our children. We need to change this, the government must act on this now-too many lives have been lost, let's prevent more!
attributes.additional_details: How can the government put a price on our children's lives?!

attributes.action: Stop speed restricted vehicles from overtaking during peak hours on motorways
attributes.background:
HGVs frequently 'elephant race' trying to pass each other. This overtaking frequently takes up to 10 miles due to the subtle differences in speed limiter calibration. 

This causes long tailbacks, dangerous pulsating traffic flow and frustration to other motorists leading to dangerous manoeuvres.
attributes.additional_details:
No other form of transport, motorised, cycling or pedestrian would you consider an overtake that took this time
Transitioning from a 2 lane motorway to a 3 lane section can lead to HGVs 3 abreast creating a rolling road block for several miles
HGVs have blind spots, pulling into spaces that either don’t exist or into traffic flow travelling much faster
Cranes, vintage vehicles and buses only capable of travelling at agricultural speeds to have time restrictions motorway travel times

attributes.action: Regulate the use of all plastics in the UK. Through a license system.
attributes.background: Many uses of plastics are unnecessary and irresponsible, the regulation should include packaging. All plastics Produced in the UK or Imported should require a license. Necessary use such as Medical and certain foods are acceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
All plastic bags should be banned other than those used for hygiene purposes and waste disposal, which should be clear, transparent bags.
This will reduce the need for recycling and lower pollution. It will also mean a responsible approach to the use of resources.

attributes.action: Urge the US president to apologise for humiliating Johnson Beharry VC
attributes.background:
The PM should make direct representations to POTUS and demand a public apology be made to HMQEII.

Johnson Beharry VC was delayed entry to the US after the POTUS ordered travel restrictions on 27 January 2017. He missed a veterans' event where he was due to be a guest of honour.
attributes.additional_details:
Johnson Beharry VC is a member of the British Army who won the UK's highest military honour for bravery in Iraq in 2004. He suffered significant injury in doing so. He described he "felt humiliated" during recent experience at JFK Airport.

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/donald-trump-muslim-ban-johnson-beharry-victoria-cross-humiliated-a7563451.html

http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/johnson-beharry-victoria-cross-war-hero-humiliated-donald-trump-travel-ban_uk_58970829e4b0768562164564

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-4192774/Victoria-Cross-war-hero-Johnson-Beharry-humiliated-US-border-officials.html

http://www.standard.co.uk/news/world/victoria-cross-hero-johnson-beharry-humiliated-after-being-caught-up-in-donald-trumps-travel-ban-a3458696.html

attributes.action: Make the Home Office settlement application process fair, transparent and smooth
attributes.background: The Home Office charge average of £2000 for each settlment application which takes up to 6 months for standard applicaiton outside the UK. The settlment processing times unfailry vary, affecting a lot of British families and make them live their life apart waiting for Home office deicision.
attributes.additional_details:
The home office currently charge very high fees for settment process submitted out of the U.K and make the process unfair and unnessarily very lengthy.

If you pay additionaly £450 you can get the application considrered in 3 weeks instead of 6 months. Other countries in Europe process the applications fairly, quickly and accurately reliable on integrity of the applicaiotn rather thatn purely on fees paid. 

On top of the applicaiton fee, you have to pay for health insurance additionaly - even if you are covered by international health insurance. 

In many cases, Home Office makes plain wrong immigration decisions  , which makes life for these families unbearable , having to wait about 1 to 2 years to solve their appeals through the courts to rectify the wrong decisions.

attributes.action: To have all school zones become 20mph for the safety of children.
attributes.background: We expect all of our children to go to school safely often schools are on busy main roads or down country lanes.  Visibility of the children can be poor and parents having to go on to work, parking can also cause a temporary hazard.  We fairly request roads have their speed limits lowered to 20mph.
attributes.additional_details:
The Road Safety Analysis (RSA) body found that there were 85,814 road incidents within a 500 mtr radius of a school equating to more than a 1,000 per month.  In 2014 the Department of Transport confirmed road deaths or serious had risen in each quarter compared to 2013.  In this period the DfT confirmed incidents increased by 6%.

These are frightening figures and it wouldn't take much to put up a few signs telling motorists to reduce their speed to 20mph at national government cost.

attributes.action: Make Manston airport UK air freight port, Gatwick & Heathrow passenger airports
attributes.background: The former Manston  RAF airstrip has an existing runway capable of use by largest  air freight planes. Thanet has good infrastructure, close to  ports of Dover & Ramsgate. Transferring all air freight  to Manston would eliminate need for third runway at Gatwick or Heathrow & improve air quality .
attributes.additional_details:
Surrounded on 2 sides by sea & closer to Europe and China than Gatwick or Heathrow. Air freight at Manston would reduce the millions of freight lorries passing through the port of Dover where infrastructure is very poor. Encourage development at the ports of Ramsgate and Tilbury make a new Thames crossing more financially viable 
Reduce high air pollution levels in Dover & Southeast
The population of Thanet & UKIP led council want an airport at Manston and need the employment opportunity.

attributes.action: Ban the use of black plastic in single use packaging.
attributes.background: Many councils do not accept black plastic in recycling schemes because it is very difficult to recycle, and can contaminate the recycling process. We suggest that the use of black plastic in single use packaging is banned.

attributes.action: All Taxi drivers licensed to Halton have free travel across the Mersey Gateway
attributes.background: Currently all Halton residents Using a Taxi will have to pay £4.00 per crossing only to get back £2.00 per crossing this is putting us out of pocket as we where promised the crossing free of charge by David Cameron and George Osborne.
attributes.additional_details: This fee that Halton residents will have to pay will leave them out of pocket because we don't drive. There are also NHS resources that need Taxis to ferry blood to Whiston Hosptial and other NHS sites in the area. Also George Osbourne and both David Cameron have made promises http://www.merseygateway.co.uk/2014/07/chancellor-of-the-exchequer-george-osborne-announces-free-trips-across-both-silver-jubilee-and-mersey-gateway-bridges-for-all-halton-residents/

attributes.action: Introduce a new law to ensure all vehicles have a dash cam installed.
attributes.background:
This will serve as a very good form of evidence, in cases of poor driving on our roads, including undertaking at speed, use of cellphones whilst driving, road rage incidents, drink driving.
I have had several cases of experiencing drivers using cellphones whilst in control of their vehicles.
attributes.additional_details: I have been able to provide, evidence of anti social behaviour to the Police who have been able to take further action deemed necessary.

attributes.action: Introduce Regular Digital Voting Referendums On The Issues That Matter
attributes.background: The technology for 'push-button digital voting' by mobile phone or pc already exists. People vote on tv show contestants all the time. Mobile and online banking are deemed to be secure. Thus there's no reason why this technology cannot be adapted for digital referendums to truly empower the people.
attributes.additional_details:
Prime Minister Theresa May has spoken of the 'shared society.' It would be nice to see some power being shared with our representatives at the UK Parliament and the devolved Parliaments and Assemblies. 

Regular digital voting on issues that matter at a local and national level, would leave everyone clear on what the majority wish for on any number of issues. A more intelligent vote could also arise; Eg: someone with good knowledge of farming would vote on it, though perhaps not vote on fishing.

attributes.action: Heavier prison scentences for pedophiles and rapists.
attributes.background: I firmly believe that the scentences handed out to pedophiles and rapists are far to lenient.When someone commits a crime against a child or rapes a person they are as good as murdering who that person once was
attributes.additional_details: Anyone who has been raped or abused will tell you they will never be the same again...in essence the person they once were is now dead...children who are abused have their childhood stolen from them..the perpetrators of such unspeakble acts deserve to be punished severly and the victims at the very least deserve the justice that harsher scentences would bring

attributes.action: Bring England in line with the rest of the UK and stop NHS prescription charges.
attributes.background: It is fundamentally unfair that citizens in England have to pay NHS prescription charges (currently £8.40) whilst in Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland they are free. These charges raise less than 0.5% of the NHS budget so are negligible, we in England should receive parity with the rest of the UK

attributes.action: Divert 50% of the foreign aid budget to tackle social care for the aged in uk
attributes.background: More councils in the uk are short of funds to tackle social care in the UK.(12 billion foreign aid budget wasted on rogue nations/state officials), to go directly to councils, so that they do not in turn raise their taxes, which are currently too high now.
attributes.additional_details: This will help to pay for more care homes and after care for the elderly and release more beds in hospitals so that we can all benefit. With an ageing population, If this situation is not tackled this way, then bigger problems will arise. It is on best affordable way forward to this and still retains 50% of the foreign aid budget, which should be more scrutinised than currently is or scrapped altogether.

attributes.action: Make the law clear that any child who assists in for profit work is employed
attributes.background: Thousands of children, many of them younger than 13 in the UK, are working in commercial research, testing, marketing and consultancy. See http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/4308213/Thousands-of-children-being-paid-to-market-products-to-schoolmates.html
attributes.additional_details: The Children and Young Persons Act 1933 prohibits children younger than 13 being used to assist in for-profit work such as that described above. However, problems with enforcing this law have caused many to turn a blind eye to this. The result is many children are being exploited –have no workers’ rights, are deprived of pay and can end up doing work such as for-profit clinical testing that is unsafe for them, and so the law needs to be made clearer to ensure this does not happen.

attributes.action: GPs to be reviewed and retrained each time misdiagnosis of cancer
attributes.background: My son was misdiagnosed three times by GPs which lead to stage three. As they are the first point of call they need to spot this early and listen to parents. This happens too many times and no one is reviewed.
attributes.additional_details: I know of three cases, myself, two friends. All GPs incorrect medical knowledge of cancer.

attributes.action: “To require the Government to repeal Section 40 of the Crime and Courts Act 2013
attributes.background: The majority of British Newspapers want nothing to do with 'Impress' as an 'independent regulator'; because the Freedom of the Press is a rare and treasured commodity.
attributes.additional_details: I refer to the excellent article written by Mr. Fraser Nelson in the Telegraph

attributes.action: Reword Rule 59 of the Highway code from 'should' to 'must'
attributes.background: The current wording of Rule 59 allows cyclists to ignore the suggestions. The rule should be revised so that cyclists MUST wear a safety helmet and at least one article of fluorescent or reflective clothing and/or accessory (visible from front and rear) at all times when cycling on the highway.
attributes.additional_details:
Car drivers and passengers MUST wear a safety belt, therefore it stands to reason that cyclists MUST wear a cycling helmet and a fluorescent/reflective item when cycling. This would help to reduce the number of incidents which occur on the roads.
There were 21,287 reported cycling casualties in 2014. Source: http://www.rospa.com/road-safety/advice/pedal-cyclists/facts-figures/
Many of these could have been avoided if cyclists were easier to see.

attributes.action: Campaign for greater involvement of the UK in the refugee resettlement
attributes.background: The reason for this petition is because we believe that the UK isn't allowing the enough number of refugees into the UK. Also we should be allowed to be part of the decision of allowing refugees in or not because at the end of the day it is the public who put decision makers in power.
attributes.additional_details: As we have put the decision makers in power they need to understand that without us they wouldn't be in power and also the reason they are in power is so that our voice can be heard.

attributes.action: Put the £369 million going into Buckingham Palace into the NHS.
attributes.background: I have been sat in the Children's A and E at the UHW for the past two hours. There are not enough seats, children sat on the floors and mother's with babies sat on baby chairs. There are not enough doctors on and it is evident the longer waiting times are distressing the children and young people.
attributes.additional_details:
During my girlfriends pregnancy, she had to wait 3 days to have her waters broken as there was not enough midwives to give the necessary supervision.

There was a mis-communication with medication due to staff being so busy they missed that she had already been administered. This could have led to an overdose. 

I have also just used the toilets at the UHW and attempted to wash my hands in three different cubicles. There is no soap in the dispensers and no running water in the sinks.

attributes.action: Fully and transparently explore the Hyperloop concept to deliver HS1 and HS2.
attributes.background:
The proposed HS1 and HS2 investments should deliver infrastructure for the future - but they are currently on-target to deploy a concept that hasn't improved since the Victorian era.

The Hyperloop is different. It offers the potential for high speeds and sustainability. We should evaluate it.
attributes.additional_details:
Full details of the design and rationale can be found here:

https://www.tesla.com/en_GB/blog/hyperloop

attributes.action: Compulsory teaching of media bias in secondary education
attributes.background: Everyday we are fed information from the media, be it TV, newspapers, news sites, billboards, etc. The media needs money, and so they will do what they need to do to be financially viable, going as far as inciting hate. Compulsory teaching of media bias may help people make more informed choices.

attributes.action: Remove Toll On Queen Elizabeth the 2nd Tunnel if in traffic longer than 30mins
attributes.background: I cross this bridge everyday and I have had enough like many others paying £2.50 and upwards to be stuck in traffic for hours

attributes.action: The British Government should apologize for the Balfour Declaration.
attributes.background:
The British Government promised a land that was not in their possession. They should claim partial responsibility for the suffering of the Palestinian people. 
The Palestinian people deserve an apology.
attributes.additional_details:
The Palestinian people need support and Israel needs to be pressured. I believe we should have two states for two people. 
The British government needs to support the Palestinian people in their pursuit of statehood.
The best way to start will be by apologising to the Palestinian people.

attributes.action: A standardised requirement for motor vehicle headlamps in lumen and colour.
attributes.background: Many are finding it increasingly difficult to drive at night due to the variations in lighting strength and colour. Often it is very difficult to differentiate a dipped headlight from the full beams. These are wreaking havoc with people's vision potentially causing accidents as they are dazzled.

attributes.action: Immediately stop and cancel IHAT investigations into British troops
attributes.background: There are investigations into British troops conduct in the Gulf area.  These were initiated by Gordon Brown.  Some investigations are still ongoing and pending, it is totally unfair to do this, our troops are the best in the World and should not be investigated in this way.
